intro: Hieracium diversicolor, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow ray florets surrounding a central disk of smaller, tubular flowers. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 centimeters. Hieracium diversicolor is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a common sight in temperate regions.
